alert.note: Alert for Bulloch; Candler; Jenkins; Screven (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 2:27PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SCREVEN, BULLOCH, JENKINS AND CANDLER COUNTIES... At 226 PM EDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Woodcliff to near Garfield to near Oak Park, and moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...strong winds 45 to 55 mph and up to nickel sized hail. SOURCE...Radar Indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to plants, trees and crops is possible. Damage to windshields is unlikely. Some locations in the path of these storms include... Statesboro, Metter, Millen, Sylvania, Butts, Portal, Hiltonia, and Pulaski. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: These storms may intensify. Be certain to monitor local radio and TV stations as well as local cable TV outlets for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so. You can also email your report to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
